question:
Consider the following differences between Censure Motion and No Confidence Motion:
  1. Unlike No-Confidence Motion, Censure Motion can be moved against individual minister
  2. Unlike No-Confidence Motion, Censure Motion does not require leave of the House
  Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Both No Confidence Motion and Censure Motion are tools of Lok Sabha to control the executive. While No-Confidence Motion can be passed only against the entire Council of Ministers and not individual ministers or private members, Censure Motion can be moved against an individual minister. Also, unlike No-Confidence Motion, the leave of the House is not required to move the Censure Motion.
